page.title: 18FARMING IN CHITTERNE
page.content: There are four farm businesses within the area, the largest controlling 1,117 acres, the smallest 1O5 acres. They provide very little employment. 6O% of the land is taken up for cereals, 3O% for fatstock, 5% dairy cattle and 5% woodland. Sheep are kept for their meat. Fleeces, which provide very little profit, are of secondary concern. Lambs are bought by abbatoirs as far away as Tiverton in Devon. Ewes for breeding are bought from the north of England, and sheep are brought to this area from the north and Wales to overwinter. Animals are taken to market in Salisbury, Frome and Chippenham.
